flags.quote: Anders Ericsson's research on deliberate practice found the same asymmetry: most time spent "practicing" generates nothing. The gains cluster in specific moments of struggle. Everything outside those moments is maintenance at best.

Anders Ericsson's research on deliberate practice found the same asymmetry: most time spent "practicing" generates nothing. The gains cluster in specific moments of struggle. Everything outside those moments is maintenance at best.
flags.note: this works because its so specific, and such an interesting fact. It does not necessarily fit everywhere, but when it does fit, its a great way of doing it
